items.title: Senior Nationals expected to quit portfolios after defying shadow cabinet
items.description: Three senior Nationals who voted against the Coalition's official position on hate speech reforms are expected to have to quit shadow cabinet for breaching rules requiring them to respect "cabinet solidarity".

items.title: Trump's America-first policies are pushing countries into China's embrace
items.description: Inside China, there's a nickname for Donald Trump that tells you everything you need to know about how the US leader's actions are increasingly seen as a gift to Beijing.

items.title: Live: ASX falls as 'sell America' trade and Trump's threats sink Wall St
items.description: The Australian share market has fallen for a third straight day as Wall Street tumbled to a one-month low on worsening relations between the US and Europe. Follow live.

items.title: Australian shark attack data reveals where bite incidents happen most
items.description: An ABC analysis of the national Shark-Incident Database shows that the average number of verified shark bite incidents recorded annually over a decade has increased every 10 years since the 1950s.

items.title: Mother of teenager found dead on K'gari says life 'will bever be the same'
items.description: The body of Canadian Piper James was found on K'gari (Fraser Island) surrounded by a pack of dingoes after she told friends she was going for an early morning swim.

items.title: Donald Trump, the madman theory, and why even Australia is not safe
items.description: One year into Trump's second term, something has become clear: even those who leave the Oval Office with a deal, beware. It might not be worth the paper it's written on.

items.title: 'This is crazy': Europe weighs how to deal with Trump's Greenland threats
items.description: America's rattled European allies are debating how to stand up to Donald Trump after he escalated his threats to take over Greenland and pledged to punish its supporters with tariffs.

items.title: A year into Trump's second term, the Supreme Court's docket is full of legal challenges
items.description: A wide range of cases challenging Donald Trump's actions have landed on the Supreme Court's docket in the past year. Here's what to know

items.title: Prime minister's national security adviser Philippa Brant resigns
items.description: Philippa Brant has resigned just months after the PM's top foreign policy adviser departed to run the Office of National Intelligence.

items.title: Australia's most expensive capital for fuel dogged by volatile price cycles
items.description: Brisbane's fuel prices are more expensive than any other capital city for the third year in a row, with the RACQ revealing the cheapest suburbs to fill up.

items.title: Live: Legends reunite two decades after epic Australian Open showdowns
items.description: Roger Federer and Marat Safin link up for a photo at the Australian Open 21 years after they met in a classic semifinal. On the court, Australian wildcard Talia Gibson lets three match points slip in a second-round loss to 23rd seed Diana Shnaider, and world number one Aryna Sabalenka storms into the third round. Follow live.

items.title: Potential 50C days ahead as WA sweats through heatwave
items.description: Towns in WA's north-west could be about to experience Australia's hottest day on record, with the weather bureau expecting temperatures of 50 degrees Celsius in some areas.

items.title: Residents told not to go into floodwaters due to risk of crocodiles and disease
items.description: Police have warned central Queensland residents against entering floodwaters, after several social media posts showed people in the shallows of a swollen river.

items.title: 'Off the charts' aurora australis puts on spectacular show across Australia
items.description: A severe geomagnetic storm has hit Earth, providing for a colourful light show in Australia's skies.

items.title: What is skimo? The newest sport at the Winter Olympics
items.description: Skimo is the newest sport at the Winter Olympics, but what is it? And who are the Aussies that will take on the challenge on the slopes of the infamous Stelvio climb?

items.title: 'Led with humanity': The remarkable life of Dame Marie Bashir
items.description: Dame Marie Bashir was the first female and first Lebanese person to become NSW governor, but her accolades span decades further back as a pioneer in mental health and psychiatry.

items.title: The public pool should be accessible for all — but for many, it isn't
items.description: A new exhibition in Western Sydney interrogates Australia's enduring love affair with the pool.

items.title: First-home buyer abandons government scheme after constant setbacks
items.description: Erin Bell's efforts to both buy a house and build a new one through a government scheme were repeatedly challenged — once because she had disclosed a new boyfriend.

items.title: State premier doubles down on gun buyback stance after PM pressure
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called on David Crisafulli to "justify" his refusal to join the national gun buyback scheme.

items.title: Three motorbikes, body found at scene of crash on Stuart Highway
items.description: Northern Territory police say they are continuing their investigations into a fatal motorbike crash between Wycliffe Well and the Devils Marbles on the Stuart Highway yesterday.

items.title: They're 'not worth much', so why are so many plants being stolen?
items.description: Data shows more than 2,000 items were reported stolen from gardens over a year in one state alone. So what can plant owners do to protect their beloved greenery from theft?

items.title: Crichton set for rugby defection to chase Wallabies World Cup dream
items.description: Star second-rower Angus Crichton will leave the Sydney Roosters at the end of the NRL season to pursue a career in rugby union.

items.title: David Beckham breaks silence after son Brooklyn cuts ties
items.description: The football superstar told broadcasters at the World Economic Forum that "children are allowed to make mistakes" in his first public comments since his son's allegations went public.

items.title: One dead, at least 15 injured after another train derails near Barcelona
items.description: One person has died and at least 15 others have been injured after a wall fell on a train track due to heavy rain near the Spanish city of Barcelona, local authorities say.

items.title: Inside the program teaching US ICE agents to 'Defend the Homeland'
items.description: For the thousands of "patriots" who've applied, a position with ICE is a source of pride. Experts, elected officials and activists say otherwise.
